definitions.definition: A lucky or improbable occurrence, with the implication that the occurrence could not be repeated.
definitions.example: The first goal was just a fluke.

definitions.definition: To obtain a successful outcome by pure chance.
definitions.example: I fluked a pass in the multiple-choice exam.

definitions.definition: To fortuitously pot a ball in an unintended way.
definitions.example: He fluked the other red into the middle pocket, despite the double kiss.

definitions.definition: A trematode; a parasitic flatworm of the Trematoda class, related to the tapeworm.
definitions.example: The man had become infected with flukes after eating a meal of raw fish.

definitions.definition: Either of the two lobes of a whale's or similar creature's tail.
definitions.example: The dolphin had an open wound on the left fluke of its tail where the propeller had injured it.

definitions.definition: Any of the triangular blades at the end of an anchor, designed to catch the ground.
definitions.example: The fluke of the anchor was wedged between two outcroppings of rock and could not be dislodged.

definitions.definition: A metal hook on the head of certain staff weapons (such as a bill), made in various forms depending on function, whether used for grappling or to penetrate armour when swung at an opponent.
definitions.example: The polearm had a wide, sharpened fluke attached to the central point.

definitions.definition: In general, a winglike formation on a central piece.
definitions.example: After casting the bronze statue, we filed down the flukes and spurs from the molding process.
